result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Matke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:35 p.m. Court calls the case and states the appearances
Cases heard today are 15CF192 and 16CF8.

Parties have received and reviewed the Pre-Sentence Investigation Record Review and have no changes.
Court has received a letter from the Defendant's mother.
Parties state they have received a copy of the letter.
Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
ADA Knaapen argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Drengler provides the Court with an order for half-priced ignition interlock device.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CF192:
6 months straight jail, concurrent with 16CF08
88 days credit

16CF8:
50 months Initial Confinement, concurrent with any sentence defendant is currently serving. 
50 Months Extended Supervision
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program & Earned Release Program after serving 30 months. 
537 days Credit 

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. 
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
Do not drive without a valid license.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent. 
$600.00 fine + costs + 26.45 blood draw.
36 month driver's license revocation 
36 month IID
Court has signed the order for half-price ignition interlock device.

Notice of Intent is provided to Atty Drengler.
Copy of Written Determinate Sentence is provided to the Defendant.
from defendant's mother - copies provided to Atty Knaapen and Atty Drengler
(sent copies to ADA Knaapen/Atty Drengler 6-2-17/kp)
from Probation Agent in re:  will be completeing a record review in lieu of a formal PSI for cases 15CF192 and 16CF8
Sentencing hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Brian K. Matke in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: 15CF192, 15CF432, 16CF8, 15TR3476, 15TR3477
1:32 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
16CF8 Count 1 - NO CONTEST
15CF192 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 16CF8 Count 1, 15CF192.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
The following are dismissed and read-in: 16CF8 Counts 2, 3 & 4, 15CF432, 15TR3476, 15TR3477

Court questions the defendant further re: prior convictions. 
Defendant admits this is his 9th OWI offense. 

BY THE COURT: 
Court orders PSI. 

Atty Knaapen asks to revoke the defendant's bond. 
Court questions Atty Drengler. 
Atty Drengler makes arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing at 03-07-2016 11:00 am

If probation and parole determines if defendant can be released.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Report to day report sober 14 times per week. Twice a day.

***Bond modified 12/22/15:
Participate in the Portage County Pre-Trial Supervision Program and comply with the requirements for reporting, assessment, and programming.
Court will allow the determination of how many times defendant is to report to Day Report through PTSP.

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:05 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Set for a motion on modification of bond.
Atty Drengler makes argument for modifying the bond in regards to the day report condition.
9:08 a.m.  Atty Knaapen makes his argument opposing the bond modification.

BY THE COURT:
Bond modified to make defendant eligible for PTSP and allow them to detemine what is most appropriate.
Motion granted to the above extent.  
The number of times needed to be reported has not changed.
for modification of bond
Motion hearing at 12-22-2015 09:00 am

Defendant Brian K. Matke in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:54 PM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Parties are prepared to proceed.

Atty Drengler has filed a motion for bond modification.

State objects to the motion.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, requests the Court to consider a reduction of day report days, for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, states objections for reasons stated on the record.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, replies.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
Motion is denied and would reconsider it later if additional circumstances exist which would give Court a better understanding of Defendant's difficulting reporting this many times per week.
Current bond continues.

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

ADA Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. Atty Drengler appears in court.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Battery to an Officer.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
